revisions.description: The MIB module for the implementation of Virtual Router.
Add cadVrGlobalAllowAnyCableMac.
Add cadVrInterfaceIsSdv.
Add cadVrInterfaceGratuitousArpEnabled.
Add Ipv6 BGP route counts support.
Added cadVrAutoImportEnabled in cadVrEntry
Added cadVrPhpEnabled in cadVrEntry Added cadVrInterfaceMplsEnabled and cadVrInterfaceLdpEnabled in cadVrInterfaceEntry
Change range of cadVrInterfacePolicyRouteMap from (0..2048) to (0..64)
Add cadVrGlobalIsisHostNameEnabled
Added route lookup table CadVrRtLookupTable
Changed the range of cadVrInterfacePolicyRouteMap
Add policy routing support.
Add cadVrStatusNumIpv6PdRoutes.
Add cadVrInterfacePdRiEnabled .
Add cadVrGlobalStatusIcmpv6UnreachablesDropped.

Add cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6UnreachablesEnabled. cadVrGlobalIcmpv6UnreachablesEnabled. cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6TooBigEnabled. cadVrGlobalIcmpv6TooBigEnabled. cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6ParameterProblemEnabled. cadVrGlobalIcmpv6ParameterProblemEnabled. cadVrICMPv6TimeExceededEnabled. cadVrInterfaceStatusIcmpv6UnreachablesDropped cadVrNullInterfacev6.

Add cadVrInterfacePsFilterDownDefault, cadVrInterfacePsFilterUpDefault, cadVrInterfaceMtaFilterDownDefault, cadVrInterfaceMtaFilterUpDefault, cadVrInterfaceStbFilterDownDefault, cadVrInterfaceStbFilterDownDefault, and cadVrSecondaryIpAddrDHCPGiaddr Deprecate cadVrSecondaryIpAddrDHCPPolicyEnabled
Revised support for ipv6 interface forwarding.
Revised support for forwarding and hop limits.
Moved cadVrOspfGracefulRestartEnabled to the end of the CadVrEntry table
Added cadVrOspfGracefulRestartEnabled to CadVrEntry table
Add support for ND configuration.
Add IP address Type and prefix length
Make the secondary address mask a key field
Added cadVrInterfaceEncapType and cadVrInterfaceVlanId to cadVrInterfaceTable
Added more route types to CadVrStatus table
Added cadVrInterfaceDescription to persist ifAlias for layer 3 interfaces
Added ICMP per-interface unreachable filtering objects
Added ICMP unreachable filtering objects and virtual router status table
Added cadVrInterfaceAdminStat for loopback interface
Added cadVrInterfaceIsLoopback for loopback interface
Added cadVrInterfaceRestrictedFARPEnabled to cadVrInterfaceTable
Obsoleted igmpEnabled and irdpEnabled bools in cadVrInterfaceTable
make cadVrInterfaceVrIndex writable
Added Support for ICMP Time Exceeded
Changed cadVRInterfaceTable to be keyed by subinterface number, so that VRF is now an attribute of the VRI instead of a key
Adding cadVrInterface*Filter*Default to cadVrInterfaceTable
Adding support for NULL interface.
Adding support for cable source verify to cadVrInterfaceTable.
Adding support for dhcp giaddr selection to cadVrSecondaryIpAddrTable.
Adding cadVrScmAccessEnabled and cadVrScmAccessDirectedBroadcastEnabled to cadVrTable
Adding igmpEnabled and irdpEnabled bools to cadVrInterfaceTable

Demoted cadVrIpAddr, cadVrIpMask from keys to read-write objects. Added cadVrIpIndex as an index. Removed the no longer-needed cadVrIfIpIsPrimary, since its functionality is being replaced by cadVrIpIndex.
Adding cadVrIfIpIsPrimary bool to cadVrIpAddrTable
Adding DHCPEnabled and FARPEnabled bools to cadVrInterfaceTable
Adding ospfEnabled and ripEnabled bools to cadVrTable
Pulling IP address definitions from interface table into their own table to support multiple IP addresses for a given interface.
Revisions made by Cadant.

CadSourceVerifyType.name: CadSourceVerifyType
CadSourceVerifyType.description: Cable Source Verify configuration option types. The value `none' implies cable source verify is inhibited. Any value other than `none' indicates some form of source verify is active. The value `internal' implies the C4's internal databases are used to verify all source addresses. `dhcp' implies DHCP lease query messaging is used if a source address cannot be verified directly via the C4's internal databases. `authoritativeDhcp' implies that DHCP lease query messaging must result in a conclusive identification of the source address on the part of the DHCP server before the C4 will allow traffic to pass for that source.

cadVrNameTable.name: cadVrNameTable
cadVrNameTable.description: The inverse table of cadVrTable, such that a manager can create/lookup a virtual router by its name instead of its index. To ensure consistency, a row must be created in this table prior to the corresponding row being created in the cadVrTable. When a row is created in this table, the SNMP agent assigns it a cadVrNameVrIndex. That value can then be used as cadVrIndex to create a row in the cadVrTable. Likewise, whenever a row is deleted from this table, the SNMP agent also removes the corresponding row from the cadVrTable.

cadVrNameVrIndex.name: cadVrNameVrIndex
cadVrNameVrIndex.description: The cadVrIndex of the row in the cadVrTable which has the same cadVrName.

cadVrNameRowStatus.name: cadVrNameRowStatus
cadVrNameRowStatus.description: The row status variable used according to row installation and removal convention. In our case, we have simplified this to the usage of only the following states - active, createAndGo, and destroy. Other three states notInService, notReady and createAndWait are not permitted.

cadVrTable.name: cadVrTable
cadVrTable.description: This entity's Virtual Routing table containing many virtual routers.

cadVrEntry.name: cadVrEntry
cadVrEntry.description: A particular virtual router. Prior to creating a row in this table, one must first create a row in the cadVrNameTable. The value that is assigned to cadVrNameVrIndex can then be used as cadVrIndex to create a row in this table. Otherwise, if one attempts to create a row in this table with an unknown cadVrIndex, the setRequest will fail.

cadVrIndex.name: cadVrIndex
cadVrIndex.description: The index value which identifies a virtual router.

cadVrName.name: cadVrName
cadVrName.description: The name of the virtual router. This name must be unique among all virtual routers. Whenever a row in this table is successfully created, its name is copied from the cadVrNameTable. Note that a row must be created in the cadVrNameTable prior to its corresponding row being created in this table.

cadVrOspfEnabled.name: cadVrOspfEnabled
cadVrOspfEnabled.description: true if OSPFv2 is to be enabled for this Virtual Router, false otherwise.

cadVrRipEnabled.name: cadVrRipEnabled
cadVrRipEnabled.description: true if RIPv2 is to be enabled for this Virtual Router, false otherwise.

cadVrRowStatus.name: cadVrRowStatus
cadVrRowStatus.description: The row status variable used according to row installation and removal convention. In our case, we have simplified this to the usage of only the following states - active, createAndGo, and destroy. Other three states notInService, notReady and createAndWait are not permitted.

cadVrScmAccessEnabled.name: cadVrScmAccessEnabled
cadVrScmAccessEnabled.description: true if SCM access is enabled for this virtual router, false otherwise

cadVrScmAccessDirectedBroadcastEnabled.name: cadVrScmAccessDirectedBroadcastEnabled
cadVrScmAccessDirectedBroadcastEnabled.description: true if SCM directed-broadcast is enabled for this virtual router, false otherwise

cadVrNullInterface.name: cadVrNullInterface
cadVrNullInterface.description: true if ICMP destination unreachable is send when routing to a null interface, false otherwise

cadVrICMPTimeExceededEnabled.name: cadVrICMPTimeExceededEnabled
cadVrICMPTimeExceededEnabled.description: true if ICMP Time Exceeded message is sent upon receiving packet with TTL = 0 or 1, false otherwise

cadVrOspfGracefulRestartEnabled.name: cadVrOspfGracefulRestartEnabled
cadVrOspfGracefulRestartEnabled.description: true if OSPF graceful restart is enabled, false otherwise.

cadVrIPv6ReflectionEnabled.name: cadVrIPv6ReflectionEnabled
cadVrIPv6ReflectionEnabled.description: true if IPv6 reflection is enabled. Only for the D card

cadVrICMPv6TimeExceededEnabled.name: cadVrICMPv6TimeExceededEnabled
cadVrICMPv6TimeExceededEnabled.description: true if ICMPv6 Time Exceeded message is sent upon receiving packet with TTL = 0 or 1, false otherwise

cadVrNullInterfacev6.name: cadVrNullInterfacev6
cadVrNullInterfacev6.description: true if ICMPv6 destination unreachable is send when routing to a null interface, false otherwise

cadVrPhpEnabled.name: cadVrPhpEnabled
cadVrPhpEnabled.description: Determines whether a VRF uses PHP or UHP for MPLS LSP tail-end behavior.

cadVrAutoImportEnabled.name: cadVrAutoImportEnabled
cadVrAutoImportEnabled.description: true if VRF is performing auto import of routes

cadVrInterfaceTable.name: cadVrInterfaceTable
cadVrInterfaceTable.description: This table defines interfaces for each virtual router. A virtual router may have multiple interfaces.

cadVrInterfaceEntry.name: cadVrInterfaceEntry
cadVrInterfaceEntry.description: An interface entry for a particular virtual router.

cadVrInterfaceIfIndex.name: cadVrInterfaceIfIndex
cadVrInterfaceIfIndex.description: Virtual router interface ID associated with a virtual router and the Bridge Group. This value is computed. It should correspond to the index value in the ifTable.

cadVrInterfaceIpAddr.name: cadVrInterfaceIpAddr
cadVrInterfaceIpAddr.description: The primary IP address for this virtual router interface. Currently, only IPv4 is supported, so only values that have 0 or 4 OCTETS are allowed. After this value has been set to 4 OCTETS, then it may not be reset back to 0 OCTETS.

cadVrInterfaceIpMask.name: cadVrInterfaceIpMask
cadVrInterfaceIpMask.description: The primary subnet mask for this virtual router interface. Currently, only IPv4 is supported, so only values that have 0 or 4 OCTETS are allowed. After this value has been set to 4 OCTETS, then it may not be reset back to 0 OCTETS.

cadVrInterfaceDHCPEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceDHCPEnabled
cadVrInterfaceDHCPEnabled.description: This is the current state of DHCP Relay for this virtual router interface. If there is at least one row in the cadVrDhcpServerTable for this interface, then this value is true. Otherwise, it is false.

cadVrInterfaceFARPEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceFARPEnabled
cadVrInterfaceFARPEnabled.description: This is the current state of ARP forwarding for this virtual router interface.

cadVrInterfaceRipEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceRipEnabled
cadVrInterfaceRipEnabled.description: If this value is set to true, then RIP is enabled for this interface. Otherwise RIP will be turned off for this interface.

cadVrInterfaceRipPassive.name: cadVrInterfaceRipPassive
cadVrInterfaceRipPassive.description: If this value is set to true, then RIP route updates will not be sent out this interface. Otherwise, RIP routes updates will be sent out this interface, but only if RIP is enabled for this interface.

cadVrInterfaceIGMPEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceIGMPEnabled
cadVrInterfaceIGMPEnabled.description: If this value is set to true, then IGMP is enabled for this interface. Otherwise IGMP will be turned off for this interface.

cadVrInterfaceIRDPEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceIRDPEnabled
cadVrInterfaceIRDPEnabled.description: If this value is set to true, then IRDP is enabled for this interface. Otherwise IRDP will be turned off for this interface.

cadVrInterfaceRowStatus.name: cadVrInterfaceRowStatus
cadVrInterfaceRowStatus.description: The row status variable used according to row installation and removal convention. In our case, we have simplified this to the usage of only the following states - active, createAndGo, and destroy. Other three states notInService, notReady and createAndWait are not permitted.

cadVrInterfaceDHCPPolicyEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceDHCPPolicyEnabled
cadVrInterfaceDHCPPolicyEnabled.description: If set to true, then the secondary IP address of this interface will be used for the giaddr.

cadVrInterfaceDirectedBcastEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceDirectedBcastEnabled
cadVrInterfaceDirectedBcastEnabled.description: If set to true, then subnet-directed broadcast IP packets are forwarded on this interface. Otherwise, subnet-directed broadcast IP packets are dropped.

cadVrInterfaceSourceVerify.name: cadVrInterfaceSourceVerify
cadVrInterfaceSourceVerify.description: Current state of Source Verify for this virtual router interface. May only assume values other than `none' for cable interfaces. May only assume values other than `none' or `internal' for cable interfaces that have a DHCP helper address defined.

cadVrInterfaceSubifIndex.name: cadVrInterfaceSubifIndex
cadVrInterfaceSubifIndex.description: The index value which identifies a subinterface.

cadVrInterfaceVrIndex.name: cadVrInterfaceVrIndex
cadVrInterfaceVrIndex.description: The cadVrIndex of the row in the cadVrTable associated with this subinterface.

cadVrInterfaceIsLoopback.name: cadVrInterfaceIsLoopback
cadVrInterfaceIsLoopback.description: Determine if this virtual router interface is a loopback interface.

cadVrInterfaceRestrictedFARPEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceRestrictedFARPEnabled
cadVrInterfaceRestrictedFARPEnabled.description: This is the current state of Restricted ARP forwarding for this virtual router interface. Note this is only valid for DOCSIS interfaces.

cadVrInterfaceAdminStat.name: cadVrInterfaceAdminStat
cadVrInterfaceAdminStat.description: The administrative status of the VRInterface. This status is only applicable to loopback interface which has CadVrInterfaceIsLoopback set to true. It could be enabled (1) or disabled (2). All other VRInterfaces will not use this field.

cadVrInterfaceIcmpUnreachablesEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceIcmpUnreachablesEnabled
cadVrInterfaceIcmpUnreachablesEnabled.description: True if ICMP unreachable messages are sent

cadVrInterfaceDescription.name: cadVrInterfaceDescription
cadVrInterfaceDescription.description: A persistent copy of ifAlias for this interface.

cadVrInterfaceEncapType.name: cadVrInterfaceEncapType
cadVrInterfaceEncapType.description: This object identifies the subinterface encapsulation type with the following values supported l3ipvlan (136) - Layer 3 Virtual LAN using IP (SIP prefix selector) l2vlan (135) - Layer 2 Virtual LAN using 802.1Q (VLANid selector)

cadVrInterfaceVlanId.name: cadVrInterfaceVlanId
cadVrInterfaceVlanId.description: - if cadVrInterfaceEncapType is l2vlan (135) then this object contains the VLANid assigned by the encapsulation dot1q <VLANid> CLI subcommand.

cadVrInterfacePriority.name: cadVrInterfacePriority
cadVrInterfacePriority.description: This object contains the enumeration of the priority values to be set in the 802.1p bits for the subinterface. The enumeration values p0(0)..p7(7) represent a fixed priority to be applied to the egress Q-tags, and the value iptos(8) represents the mapping from IP TOS precedence bits to the 802.1p bits on egress. The default value is p0(0).

cadVrInterfaceScmAccess.name: cadVrInterfaceScmAccess
cadVrInterfaceScmAccess.description: This object contains the SCM access permissions whenever the cadVrInterfaceEncapType object is set to l2vlan. The default value is false(2).

cadVrInterfaceIpAddrType.name: cadVrInterfaceIpAddrType
cadVrInterfaceIpAddrType.description: The primary IP address type for this virtual router interface.

cadVrInterfaceIpPrefixLength.name: cadVrInterfaceIpPrefixLength
cadVrInterfaceIpPrefixLength.description: The prefix length for this virtual router interface IPv4 address. Used in lieu of the subnet mask.

cadVrInterfaceIpScopeType.name: cadVrInterfaceIpScopeType
cadVrInterfaceIpScopeType.description: The scope type for this virtual router interface IP address. Applicable to IPv6 addresses.

cadVrInterfaceIpv6Addr.name: cadVrInterfaceIpv6Addr
cadVrInterfaceIpv6Addr.description: The primary IP address for this virtual router interface. This is the IPv6 address, so only values that have 8 or 16 OCTETS are allowed.

cadVrInterfaceIpv6PrefixLength.name: cadVrInterfaceIpv6PrefixLength
cadVrInterfaceIpv6PrefixLength.description: The prefix length for this virtual router interface IPv6 address. Used in lieu of the subnet mask.

cadVrInterfaceDADAttempts.name: cadVrInterfaceDADAttempts
cadVrInterfaceDADAttempts.description: The pnumber of IPv6 duplicate address messages sent

cadVrInterfaceIpv6Forwarding.name: cadVrInterfaceIpv6Forwarding
cadVrInterfaceIpv6Forwarding.description: Determines whether IPv6 traffic should be allowed on this interface.

cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6UnreachablesEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6UnreachablesEnabled
cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6UnreachablesEnabled.description: True if ICMPv6 unreachable messages are sent

cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6TooBigEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6TooBigEnabled
cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6TooBigEnabled.description: True if ICMPv6 too big messages are sent

cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6ParameterProblemEnab.name: cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6ParameterProblemEnabled
cadVrInterfaceIcmpv6ParameterProblemEnab.description: True if ICMPv6 parameter problem messages are sent

cadVrInterfacePdRiEnabled.name: cadVrInterfacePdRiEnabled
cadVrInterfacePdRiEnabled.description: Enable or disable route injection for DHCP Relay IPv6 prefix delegation per interface

cadVrInterfacePolicyRouteMap.name: cadVrInterfacePolicyRouteMap
cadVrInterfacePolicyRouteMap.description: Id of the policy route map to use for packets traversing this interface. 0 implies no policy routing.

cadVrInterfaceMplsEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceMplsEnabled
cadVrInterfaceMplsEnabled.description: If this value is set to true, then MPLS encapsulation is enabled for this interface. Otherwise MPLS Encapsulation will be turned off for this interface.

cadVrInterfaceLdpEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceLdpEnabled
cadVrInterfaceLdpEnabled.description: If this value is set to true, then LDP is enabled for this interface. Otherwise LDP will be turned off for this interface.

cadVrInterfaceGratuitousArpEnabled.name: cadVrInterfaceGratuitousArpEnabled
cadVrInterfaceGratuitousArpEnabled.description: Enable or disable sending gratuitous ARPs on an Ethernet or a LAG interface.

cadVrInterfaceIsSdv.name: cadVrInterfaceIsSdv
cadVrInterfaceIsSdv.description: Indicates whether this interface is the global SDV multicast interface.

cadVrSecondaryIpAddrTable.name: cadVrSecondaryIpAddrTable
cadVrSecondaryIpAddrTable.description: This table defines secondary interfaces for each virtual router. A virtual router may have multiple interfaces. A virtual router interface is uniquely identified by its {cadVrInterfaceSubifIndex, cadBgIndex} tuple. Each virtual router interface may also have zero(0) or one(1) primary IP addresses associated with it. There must be a primary address bound to an interface before any secondary IP addresses may be assigned to that same interface. There may be as many secondary IP addresses as desired.

cadVrSecondaryIpAddrEntry.name: cadVrSecondaryIpAddrEntry
cadVrSecondaryIpAddrEntry.description: A secondary, or aliased, IP address for a particular virtual router interface.

cadVrSecondaryIpMask.name: cadVrSecondaryIpMask
cadVrSecondaryIpMask.description: The subnet mask for this secondary IP address for this virtual router interface. Currently, only IPv4 is supported, so only values that have 0 or 4 OCTETS are allowed. After this value has been set to 4 OCTETS, then it may not be reset back to 0 OCTETS.

cadVrSecondaryIpAddrRowStatus.name: cadVrSecondaryIpAddrRowStatus
cadVrSecondaryIpAddrRowStatus.description: The row status variable used according to row installation and removal convention. In our case, we have simplified this to the usage of only the following states - active, createAndGo, and destroy. The other three states: notInService, notReady and createAndWait, are not permitted.

cadVrSecondaryIpAddrDHCPPolicyEnabled.name: cadVrSecondaryIpAddrDHCPPolicyEnabled
cadVrSecondaryIpAddrDHCPPolicyEnabled.description: This SNMP entry is no longer used and has been replaced by cadVrSecondaryIpAddrDHCPGiaddr. Old description: 'If set to true, then the secondary IP address of this interface will be among those used for the giaddr for DHCP of CPEs.'

cadVrSecondaryIpPrefixLength.name: cadVrSecondaryIpPrefixLength
cadVrSecondaryIpPrefixLength.description: The IP prefix length for this secondary IP address for this virtual router interface. This is used in lieu of the subnet mask.

cadVrSecondaryIpAddrType.name: cadVrSecondaryIpAddrType
cadVrSecondaryIpAddrType.description: The IP address type for this secondary IP address for this virtual router interface.

cadVrSecondaryIpScopeType.name: cadVrSecondaryIpScopeType
cadVrSecondaryIpScopeType.description: The scope type for this virtual router interface IP address. Applicable to IPv6 addresses.

cadVrSecondaryIpAddrDHCPGiaddr.name: cadVrSecondaryIpAddrDHCPGiaddr
cadVrSecondaryIpAddrDHCPGiaddr.description: If set, then the secondary IP address of this interface will be among those used for the giaddr for DHCP of that particular type of CPE host. Note: CPE is the default type for any device which can not be classified via option 43.2 or 60 of the DHCP-DISCOVER message.

cadVrStatusTable.name: cadVrStatusTable
cadVrStatusTable.description: This entity's Virtual Routing status table containing many virtual routers.

cadVrStatusVrIndex.name: cadVrStatusVrIndex
cadVrStatusVrIndex.description: The index value which identifies a virtual router.

cadVrStatusNumLocalRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumLocalRoutes
cadVrStatusNumLocalRoutes.description: The number of IPv4 local routes.

cadVrStatusNumNetmgmtRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumNetmgmtRoutes
cadVrStatusNumNetmgmtRoutes.description: The number of IPv4 network management routes.

cadVrStatusNumRipRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumRipRoutes
cadVrStatusNumRipRoutes.description: The number of IPv4 RIP routes.

cadVrStatusNumIsisInternal1Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIsisInternal1Routes
cadVrStatusNumIsisInternal1Routes.description: The number of IPv4 internal level 1 IS-IS routes.

cadVrStatusNumIsisInternal2Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIsisInternal2Routes
cadVrStatusNumIsisInternal2Routes.description: The number of IPv4 internal level 2 IS-IS routes.

cadVrStatusNumIsisExternal1Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIsisExternal1Routes
cadVrStatusNumIsisExternal1Routes.description: The number of IPv4 external level 1 IS-IS routes.

cadVrStatusNumIsisExternal2Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIsisExternal2Routes
cadVrStatusNumIsisExternal2Routes.description: The number of IPv4 external level 2 IS-IS routes.

cadVrStatusNumBgpIntRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumBgpIntRoutes
cadVrStatusNumBgpIntRoutes.description: The number of IPv4 internal BGP routes.

cadVrStatusNumBgpExtRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumBgpExtRoutes
cadVrStatusNumBgpExtRoutes.description: The number of IPv4 external BGP routes.

cadVrStatusNumBgpVpnRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumBgpVpnRoutes
cadVrStatusNumBgpVpnRoutes.description: The number of IPv4 VPN BGP routes.

cadVrStatusNumOspfIntraAreaRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumOspfIntraAreaRoutes
cadVrStatusNumOspfIntraAreaRoutes.description: The number of IPv4 OSPF intra-area routes.

cadVrStatusNumOspfInterAreaRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumOspfInterAreaRoutes
cadVrStatusNumOspfInterAreaRoutes.description: The number of IPv4 OSPF inter-area routes.

cadVrStatusNumOspfInternal1Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumOspfInternal1Routes
cadVrStatusNumOspfInternal1Routes.description: The number of IPv4 OSPF internal-1 routes.

cadVrStatusNumOspfInternal2Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumOspfInternal2Routes
cadVrStatusNumOspfInternal2Routes.description: The number of IPv4 OSPF internal-2 routes.

cadVrStatusNumOspfExternal1Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumOspfExternal1Routes
cadVrStatusNumOspfExternal1Routes.description: The number of IPv4 OSPF external-1 routes.

cadVrStatusNumOspfExternal2Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumOspfExternal2Routes
cadVrStatusNumOspfExternal2Routes.description: The number of IPv4 OSPF external-2 routes.

cadVrStatusNumOspfNssaExternal1Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumOspfNssaExternal1Routes
cadVrStatusNumOspfNssaExternal1Routes.description: The number of IPv4 OSPF NSSA external-1 routes.

cadVrStatusNumOspfNssaExternal2Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumOspfNssaExternal2Routes
cadVrStatusNumOspfNssaExternal2Routes.description: The number of IPv4 OSPF NSSA external-2 routes.

cadVrStatusNumOtherRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumOtherRoutes
cadVrStatusNumOtherRoutes.description: The number of IPv4 routes that are not classified.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6LocalRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6LocalRoutes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6LocalRoutes.description: The number of IPv6 local routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6NetmgmtRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6NetmgmtRoutes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6NetmgmtRoutes.description: The number of IPv6 network management routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisInternal1Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisInternal1Routes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisInternal1Routes.description: The number of IPv6 internal level 1 IS-IS routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisInternal2Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisInternal2Routes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisInternal2Routes.description: The number of IPv6 internal level 2 IS-IS routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisExternal1Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisExternal1Routes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisExternal1Routes.description: The number of IPv6 external level 1 IS-IS routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisExternal2Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisExternal2Routes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6IsisExternal2Routes.description: The number of IPv6 external level 2 IS-IS routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfIntraAreaRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfIntraAreaRoutes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfIntraAreaRoutes.description: The number of IPv6 OSPF intra-area routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfInterAreaRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfInterAreaRoutes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfInterAreaRoutes.description: The number of IPv6 OSPF inter-area routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfInternal1Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfInternal1Routes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfInternal1Routes.description: The number of IPv6 OSPF internal-1 routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfInternal2Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfInternal2Routes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfInternal2Routes.description: The number of IPv6 OSPF internal-2 routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfExternal1Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfExternal1Routes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfExternal1Routes.description: The number of IPv6 OSPF external-1 routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfExternal2Routes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfExternal2Routes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfExternal2Routes.description: The number of IPv6 OSPF external-2 routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfNssaExternal1Route.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfNssaExternal1Routes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfNssaExternal1Route.description: The number of IPv6 OSPF NSSA external-1 routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfNssaExternal2Route.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfNssaExternal2Routes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6OspfNssaExternal2Route.description: The number of IPv6 OSPF NSSA external-2 routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6PdRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6PdRoutes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6PdRoutes.description: The number of IPv6 PD routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6OtherRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6OtherRoutes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6OtherRoutes.description: The number of IPv6 routes that are not classified.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6BgpIntRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6BgpIntRoutes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6BgpIntRoutes.description: The number of IPv6 internal BGP routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6BgpExtRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6BgpExtRoutes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6BgpExtRoutes.description: The number of IPv6 external BGP routes.

cadVrStatusNumIpv6BgpVpnRoutes.name: cadVrStatusNumIpv6BgpVpnRoutes
cadVrStatusNumIpv6BgpVpnRoutes.description: The number of IPv6 VPN BGP routes.

cadVrInterfaceStatusTable.name: cadVrInterfaceStatusTable
cadVrInterfaceStatusTable.description: This entity's Virtual Routing Interface status table containing many virtual interfaces.

cadVrInterfaceStatusEntry.name: cadVrInterfaceStatusEntry
cadVrInterfaceStatusEntry.description: A particular virtual router interface's status.

cadVrInterfaceStatusIfIndex.name: cadVrInterfaceStatusIfIndex
cadVrInterfaceStatusIfIndex.description: Virtual router interface ID. This value is computed. It should correspond to the index value in the ifTable.

cadVrInterfaceStatusIcmpUnreachablesDrop.name: cadVrInterfaceStatusIcmpUnreachablesDropped
cadVrInterfaceStatusIcmpUnreachablesDrop.description: The number of ICMP unreachable packets dropped.

cadVrInterfaceStatusIcmpv6UnreachablesDr.name: cadVrInterfaceStatusIcmpv6UnreachablesDropped
cadVrInterfaceStatusIcmpv6UnreachablesDr.description: The number of ICMPv6 unreachable packets dropped.

cadVrGlobalIcmpUnreachablesEnabled.name: cadVrGlobalIcmpUnreachablesEnabled
cadVrGlobalIcmpUnreachablesEnabled.description: True if ICMP unreachable messages are sent

cadVrGlobalIpForwarding.name: cadVrGlobalIpForwarding
cadVrGlobalIpForwarding.description: The indication of whether this entity is acting as an IPv4 router in respect to the forwarding of datagrams received by, but not addressed to, this entity. IPv4 routers forward datagrams. IPv4 hosts do not (except those source-routed via the host).

cadVrGlobalIpDefaultTTL.name: cadVrGlobalIpDefaultTTL
cadVrGlobalIpDefaultTTL.description: The default value inserted into the Time-To-Live field of the IPv4 header of datagrams originated at this entity, whenever a TTL value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.

cadVrGlobalIpv6IpForwarding.name: cadVrGlobalIpv6IpForwarding
cadVrGlobalIpv6IpForwarding.description: The indication of whether this entity is acting as an IPv6 router on any interface in respect to the forwarding of datagrams received by, but not addressed to, this entity. IPv6 routers forward datagrams. IPv6 hosts do not (except those source-routed via the host).

cadVrGlobalIpv6IpDefaultHopLimit.name: cadVrGlobalIpv6IpDefaultHopLimit
cadVrGlobalIpv6IpDefaultHopLimit.description: The default value inserted into the Hop Limit field of the IPv6 header of datagrams originated at this entity whenever a Hop Limit value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.

cadVrGlobalIcmpv6UnreachablesEnabled.name: cadVrGlobalIcmpv6UnreachablesEnabled
cadVrGlobalIcmpv6UnreachablesEnabled.description: True if ICMPv6 unreachable messages are sent

cadVrGlobalIcmpv6TooBigEnabled.name: cadVrGlobalIcmpv6TooBigEnabled
cadVrGlobalIcmpv6TooBigEnabled.description: True if ICMPv6 too big enabled.

cadVrGlobalIcmpv6ParameterProblemEnabled.name: cadVrGlobalIcmpv6ParameterProblemEnabled
cadVrGlobalIcmpv6ParameterProblemEnabled.description: True if ICMPv6 too big enabled.

cadVrGlobalAllowAnyCableMac.name: cadVrGlobalAllowAnyCableMac
cadVrGlobalAllowAnyCableMac.description: True if disabling unicast upstream cable-mac checking of the Ethernet DMAC.

cadVrGlobalStatusIcmpUnreachablesDropped.name: cadVrGlobalStatusIcmpUnreachablesDropped
cadVrGlobalStatusIcmpUnreachablesDropped.description: The number of ICMP unreachable packets dropped.

cadVrGlobalStatusIcmpv6UnreachablesDropp.name: cadVrGlobalStatusIcmpv6UnreachablesDropped
cadVrGlobalStatusIcmpv6UnreachablesDropp.description: The number of ICMPv6 unreachable packets dropped.

cadVrAddressPrefixTable.name: cadVrAddressPrefixTable
cadVrAddressPrefixTable.description: This table defines prefixes for each virtual router interface. A virtual router interface may have multiple prefixes.

cadVrAddressPrefixEntry.name: cadVrAddressPrefixEntry
cadVrAddressPrefixEntry.description: An interface entry for a particular virtual router.

cadVrAddressPrefixType.name: cadVrAddressPrefixType
cadVrAddressPrefixType.description: The address type of the the address prefix.

cadVrAddressPrefixPrefix.name: cadVrAddressPrefixPrefix
cadVrAddressPrefixPrefix.description: The address prefix. The address type of this object is specified in ipAddressPrefixType. The length of this object is the standard length for objects of that type (4 or 16 bytes). Any bits after ipAddressPrefixLength must be zero. Implementors need to be aware that, if the size of ipAddressPrefixPrefix exceeds 114 octets, then OIDS of instances of columns in this row will have more than 128 sub-identifiers and cannot be accessed using SNMPv1, SNMPv2c, or SNMPv3.

cadVrAddressPrefixLength.name: cadVrAddressPrefixLength
cadVrAddressPrefixLength.description: The prefix length associated with this prefix. The value 0 has no special meaning for this object. It simply refers to address '::/0'.

cadVrAddressPrefixAdvertiseFlag.name: cadVrAddressPrefixAdvertiseFlag
cadVrAddressPrefixAdvertiseFlag.description: This object have the true(1), if this prefix can be sent in router advertisements. If false(2), it is not sent in router advertisements.

cadVrAddressPrefixOnLinkFlag.name: cadVrAddressPrefixOnLinkFlag
cadVrAddressPrefixOnLinkFlag.description: This object have the true(1), if this prefix can be sent in router advertisements. If false(2), it is not sent in router advertisements.

cadVrAddressPrefixAutonomousFlag.name: cadVrAddressPrefixAutonomousFlag
cadVrAddressPrefixAutonomousFlag.reference: For IPv6 RFC 2461, especially sections 2 and 4.6.2 and RFC 2462
cadVrAddressPrefixAutonomousFlag.description: Autonomous address configuration flag. When true(1), indicates that this prefix can be used for autonomous address configuration (i.e., can be used to form a local interface address). If false(2), it is not used to auto- configure a local interface address. The default for IPv4 prefixes is 'false(2)'.

cadVrAddressPrefixAdvPreferredLifetime.name: cadVrAddressPrefixAdvPreferredLifetime
cadVrAddressPrefixAdvPreferredLifetime.reference: For IPv6 RFC 2461, especially sections 2 and 4.6.2 and RFC 2462
cadVrAddressPrefixAdvPreferredLifetime.description: The remaining length of time, in seconds, that this prefix will continue to be preferred, i.e., time until deprecation. A value of 4,294,967,295 represents infinity. The address generated from a deprecated prefix should no longer be used as a source address in new communications, but packets received on such an interface are processed as expected. The default for IPv4 prefixes is 4,294,967,295 (infinity).

cadVrAddressPrefixAdvValidLifetime.name: cadVrAddressPrefixAdvValidLifetime
cadVrAddressPrefixAdvValidLifetime.reference: For IPv6 RFC 2461, especially sections 2 and 4.6.2 and RFC 2462
cadVrAddressPrefixAdvValidLifetime.description: The remaining length of time, in seconds, that this prefix will continue to be valid, i.e., time until invalidation. A value of 4,294,967,295 represents infinity. The address generated from an invalidated prefix should not appear as the destination or source address of a packet. The default for IPv4 prefixes is 4,294,967,295 (infinity).

cadVrAddressPrefixAdvPreferredDate.name: cadVrAddressPrefixAdvPreferredDate
cadVrAddressPrefixAdvPreferredDate.reference: For IPv6 RFC 2461, especially sections 2 and 4.6.2 and RFC 2462
cadVrAddressPrefixAdvPreferredDate.description: The date that this prefix will continue to be preferred. The address generated from a deprecated prefix should no longer be used as a source address in new communications, but packets received on such an interface are processed as expected.

cadVrAddressPrefixAdvValidDate.name: cadVrAddressPrefixAdvValidDate
cadVrAddressPrefixAdvValidDate.reference: For IPv6 RFC 2461, especially sections 2 and 4.6.2 and RFC 2462
cadVrAddressPrefixAdvValidDate.description: The date that this prefix will continue to be valid. The address generated from an invalidated prefix should not appear as the destination or source address of a packet.

cadVrAddressPrefixRowStatus.name: cadVrAddressPrefixRowStatus
cadVrAddressPrefixRowStatus.description: The control for adding and removing address prefix rows. Setting this value to createAndGo(4) will cause a row to be added, and setting this value to destroy(6) will cause the row to be removed. These are the only two values that may be set.

cadVrRtLookupTable.name: cadVrRtLookupTable
cadVrRtLookupTable.description: This entity's Virtual Routing status table containing many virtual routers.

cadVrRtLookupVrIndex.name: cadVrRtLookupVrIndex
cadVrRtLookupVrIndex.description: The index value which identifies a virtual router.

cadVrRtLookupInetAddrType.name: cadVrRtLookupInetAddrType
cadVrRtLookupInetAddrType.description: The ipv4 or ipv6 address type of the the address prefix.

cadVrRtLookupInetAddr.name: cadVrRtLookupInetAddr
cadVrRtLookupInetAddr.description: The IP address for the lookup.

cadVrRtLookupInetAddrResult.name: cadVrRtLookupInetAddrResult
cadVrRtLookupInetAddrResult.description: The IP address result from the lookup.

cadVrRtLookupPrefixLengthResult.name: cadVrRtLookupPrefixLengthResult
cadVrRtLookupPrefixLengthResult.description: The address prefix length result from the lookup
